which do not contribute to PHC diﬀusion (see also Discussion).
directionality is not as anisotropic as was the case for the other

times faster than diﬀusion along the nonpolar direction:
The Grotthuss proton hole transport mechanism for OH
aqueous solution (Fig. 1) relies on the fact that an OH
participate in a proton transfer event with
O molecules. If there were only one neighboring
O molecule, the proton hole would have reached a “dead
end”, forcing the next PT event to formagain the previous OH
(barring hydrogen bond uctuations). In dilute aqueous solu-
